content:
Got it! Based on your preferences, I've created a sample schedule for you that meets your goals of 3 times a week at the gym and fits in some outdoor activities. Feel free to adjust it as needed to accommodate your unpredictable schedule.

**Monday (Rest Day)**

* Take a well-deserved rest day and enjoy a relaxing morning!

**Tuesday**

* Morning: Gym (60-90 minutes)
* Evening: Free time (you can use this time to catch up on work, relax, or do something you enjoy)

**Wednesday**

* Morning: Outdoor activity - Jogging (30 minutes)
* Evening: Gym (60-90 minutes)

**Thursday**

* Morning: Free time (you can use this time to catch up on work, relax, or do something you enjoy)
* Evening: Gym (60-90 minutes)

**Friday**

* Morning: Free time (you can use this time to catch up on work, relax, or do something you enjoy)
* Evening: Free time (you can use this time to catch up on work, relax, or do something you enjoy)

**Saturday**

* Morning: Outdoor activity - Cycling (30 minutes)
* Afternoon/Evening: Free time (you can use this time to catch up on work, relax, or do something you enjoy)

**Sunday (Alternative Rest Day)**

* If you need an extra rest day, take it! If not, you can use this day to fit in an additional outdoor activity or gym session.

This schedule allows you to:

* Visit the gym three times a week (Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday)
* Fit in two outdoor activities (Wednesday morning jogging and Saturday morning cycling)
* Have one rest day (Monday) and an alternative rest day (Sunday)
* Enjoy some free time in the evenings and on Friday to relax or catch up on work

Remember, feel free to adjust this schedule as needed to accommodate your unpredictable schedule. If you need to swap days or skip a workout, that's okay! The goal is to find a balance that works for you and helps you maintain your progress.
